answers.answer: Maybe you should talk to your doctor. Sounds like depression. Hope you feel better

Just relax everything ur displaying is being pregnant I'm going through a lot to I have spd and I feel like my vagina is going to fall off I'm in constant pain all day so your not the only one everything will be ok just get some rest and calm down your going to stress your baby out and that's not good

Talk to ur doctor, sounds like depression, they will give u something to take n some counselling. Poor u. ( i know u said not to talk abt it but, seriously? the beer was kind of selfish, regular or not, how many times wil u rum for a beer?) goodluck n get well. Hope u learn to accept n love that baby. Prayin for u

Thanks. I have and I've been put on a low dosage of Zoloft. I'm angry that I'm putting this in my body which can hurt my baby, all because I can't pull myself together and act like an adult. It's not really having any positive or negative effect so far. Thanks though. I guess there are no real solutions other than patience, exercise and in my case, prayer. Thanks for letting me vent, it helps!

I went through something similar with my second child,  though out was mainly because my slide was not supportive. ... prayer helped me. ..I found myself praying majority of the day and what helped me the most was actually reading the bible for encouraging words. .. ill b posting that you overcome these stress and that you enjoy to the fullest the next three months to come. ..I have 10wks! Yikes!:) b blessed
I was trying to say, Angelbabymike- good luck to you! And that's not a bad idea. Thanks!
Mylaifa- nope, not going to bite on the beer comment. Yesterday I turned 33 and even after receiving beautiful diamonds earrings, I couldn't stop crying and never left my bed. Today, I'd had enough.

I am so sorry you feel the way you do. I have had similar feelings. Everything makes me cry and I get snippy very quickly. I am around the same due date. 91 days to go. I want my daughter out now if I could. I don't go anywhere and I don't want to. I want you to know you aren't alone. I have gotten so stressed out I have actually made my body physically sick. I found church, this support group, and my best friend helped. I also started seeing a therapist to help me work through my anxiety. I will pray for you. Consider seeing a therapist.

I have recently become very depressed when I found out I have gestational diabetes.... it wasnt a problem I had with my first daughter and at this point I feel completely out of controk with everything. ... everything makes me cry and I am pretty much inconsolable.... I hate having to be on a diet while pregnant and I hate having to prick my fingers 4 times a day..
same here about the gestational diabetes..I am so scared about getting Diabetes after my delivery:(....the diet and testing multiple times a day + insulin are really bad

I think most of us have been in your position. Pregnancy depression is very common. There really isn't much you can do but talk to your Dr and be honest about how your feeling. Maybe once you get a chance to let it out and talk to someone who can relate will help a little. And just stay as healthy as possible. Keep telling yourself this isn't a forever thing. That baby will get out sooner than later. Is it possible to take time from work? Or maybe you can treat yourself to a pedicure or prenatal massage. Take the necessary time to yourself and relax mama. It will get better and it will be over soon. Good luck praying for some relief ;-)

Give the Zoloft time to work. It usually takes at least 2 weeks to get into your system completely. It won't hurt your baby...mine is perfectly healthy and I took it too. Until it does kick in, try some relaxation techniques and warm baths. Good luck!!

I feel your pain i'm 27weeks and i hate being pregnant i'm sick of hearing from my family how great their pregnancy was. Every pregnancy is different and try to hold out a little longer you only have one trimester to go :)

Im 27 weeks with my second, with my first who is now 11 i did not feel that bond in utero like i do with my second. My neighbor 28 weeks who is having her first dont have that bond either in utero, i think its harder to comprehend it all the first time around for some.

question: I'm 33 years old and 27 weeks along with my first child. I'm miserable and have no idea how I'm going to make it another 90 days. I've just almost overnight blown up and feel like a whale and I despise having to find something to wear and go face the world each day. I'm beginning to feel like a circus act at work as people act like I'm the first pregnant lady they have ever seen.I've gone from a cute, size 4 to a 12-14. I've already gained 29 pounds and I'm beginning to lose myself I'm so depressed. It's like I want to either punch someone or cry all the time with no break.Well today I lost it and actually drank 3 beers over a course of 4 hours by myself crying the entire time. I don't know how I am going to make it mentally and physically for 3 more months. My husband is constantly pointing out how long it's been since we've had sex and that makes me feel worse because lately I jerk away whenever he even tries to hug me and the thought of anything intimate just makes me want to climb out of my skin!What is WRONG with me?? Whenever I try to talk to my mom she just takes his side on everythingaand makes me feel guilty because "she just LOVED being pregnant" and I should stop being so selfish.Am I not cut out for this?? I don't feel that bond that I thought every woman did. If anything, I have to stop myself from being angry at an unborn baby who I'm supposed to love and nurture for "making" me feel this way. I just feel so suffocated, fat, scared and want to feel like myself again and I'm scared that I will never come back.Any advice or suggestions? Please don't harp about the beer. At the time, I needed to chill because I was losing it. Not a regular thing by any means..
title: Afraid of labor and unsure i can do this
